items.title: Reebelo’s chief commercial officer exits after profitability
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Hari Vijayarajan, chief commercial officer at Reebelo, has resigned after nearly ten years.
- He was instrumental in achieving EBIT profitability and expanding into used fashion and refurbished sports gear.
- Vijayarajan contributed to multiple areas, including HR, finance, legal, marketing, operations, and technology.
- After his departure, he plans to take time off for family and wellness, and explore interests in AI and coaching.

items.title: Korean won hits 2-year low against yen on tariff concerns
items.summary:
- The Korean won fell to a two-year low of 1,000 won per 100 yen amid global economic uncertainties.
- US administration’s tariff policies have influenced this decline, driving investors to safe-haven assets like the Japanese yen.
- On Apr. 3, the won traded at 996.33 per 100 yen, its weakest since Apr. 27, 2023, when it was at 1001.71, before rebounding to 981.82 by Apr. 4.
- The yen-dollar exchange rate was 147.02 yen per dollar, with the US dollar index dropping to its lowest in six months.

items.title: Meta ends US fact-checking on Apr. 7
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Meta will cease its fact-checking operations in the U.S. starting April 7.
- This decision reflects a shift in Meta's approach to content moderation and fact-checking.
- The policy change is in line with broader trends in social media platforms regarding misinformation and accountability.

items.title: GitHub AI assistant sets new limits, adds premium model fees
Musk, OpenAI lawsuit set for trial in Mar-May 2026
items.summary:
- A federal jury trial for Elon Musk's lawsuit against OpenAI is scheduled for spring 2026, specifically between March and May.
- The lawsuit focuses on OpenAI's transition to a for-profit model, which Musk has criticized.
- Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers expedited proceedings but denied Musk's request to halt the transition.
- Musk claims OpenAI and CEO Sam Altman have abandoned their original mission to benefit the public.
- OpenAI denies these allegations, stating the for-profit model is essential for funding and competitiveness.
- Altman rejected a US$97.4 billion takeover offer from Musk, asserting OpenAI is not for sale.
- The lawsuit reflects the rivalry between Musk and Altman, especially after Musk launched his AI startup xAI in 2023.

items.title: Microsoft adds personalization to its AI helper tool
items.summary:
- Microsoft introduced new personalization features to its AI helper tool.
- The update aims to enhance user experience by catering to individual preferences.
- This move reflects Microsoft's ongoing investment in AI technology and user-centric design.

items.title: Trump grants 75-day extension for TikTok sale
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- President Trump has granted a 75-day extension for the sale of TikTok.
- The extension allows more time for negotiations with potential buyers amid ongoing national security concerns.
- This decision comes as the deadline for the sale was originally set to expire soon.

items.title: Google, Amazon push to curb Microsoft’s federal hold
items.summary:
- Google and Amazon are increasing lobbying to challenge Microsoft’s dominance in federal software contracts.
- They are advocating for better competition and addressing concerns over software procurement costs.
- The Department of Government Efficiency is conducting a software license inventory for cost savings.
- Microsoft holds 31% of federal software spending, amounting to approximately US$2.4 billion in 2021.
- Senator Joni Ernst introduced legislation for license consolidation, potentially saving US$750 million annually.
- There are concerns that Microsoft’s market share leads to higher costs and cybersecurity issues.
- Recent scrutiny over Microsoft includes a 2023 Chinese hacker breach and a 2024 cloud failure.
- Amazon and Google allege Microsoft’s contracts hinder fair competition, prompting calls for procurement reforms.

items.title: Mapping India’s education key startups
Chinese biotech firms see 18% rise in overseas deals in Q1
items.summary:
- Chinese biotech companies reported an 18% increase in overseas deals in Q1 2025, totaling 33 transactions worth US$36.2 billion.
- This is an increase from 28 agreements during the same period last year.
- The largest deal involved GeneQuantum, Biohaven, and AimedBio, while Harbour BioMed's US$4.7 billion collaboration with AstraZeneca focuses on antibodies for immunology and oncology.

items.title: China imposes 34% tariff in response to Trump’s levies
items.summary:
- China has announced a 34% tariff on imported American goods.
- This move follows the imposition of a similar 34% tariff by US President Donald Trump on Chinese imports.
- China's Ministry of Commerce condemned the tariffs as a threat to global trade and urged the US to resolve disputes through dialogue.

items.title: Vickers founder Finian Tan testifies in $1.45b nickel fraud case
items.summary:
- Finian Tan testified on Apr. 3 in Singapore’s High Court regarding dealings with Ng Yu Zhi.
- Ng Yu Zhi is accused of running a $1.45 billion nickel-trading scam.
- Tan was allegedly tricked into investing $19.2 million in Envy Global Trading under false pretenses.
- The meeting that led to the investment was arranged by Veronica Shim, then CEO of Envysion Wealth Management.
- Ng faces 108 charges, including fraud, forgery, and money laundering.

items.title: Xiaomi SU7 crash sparks debate on lidar in autonomous driving
items.summary:
- A recent crash involving the Xiaomi SU7 has prompted discussions about the reliability of lidar technology in autonomous vehicles.
- Advocates argue that lidar is crucial for safe navigation, while critics question its necessity and effectiveness compared to other sensors.
- The incident has raised concerns about the broader implications for autonomous driving regulations and public trust in self-driving technology.

items.title: Giving investors more than numbers
items.summary:
[The article discusses the limitations of traditional numerical data in investment decisions.]
[It emphasizes the importance of qualitative information and insights for investors.]
[The piece invites readers to reconsider the way they evaluate investment opportunities beyond just metrics.]

items.title: Meet the 100 top-funded startups and tech companies in China
Aerem bags $12m series A led by Japanese VC firm
items.author: Anand Jain, Vikesh Agrawal
items.summary:
- Aerem, a Mumbai-based solar financing startup, raised ₹100 crore (US$12 million) in a Series A funding round.
- The funding was led by Japan’s University of Tokyo Edge Capital Partners, with participation from British International Investment, SE Ventures, Riverwalk Holdings, and existing investors Blume Ventures and Avaana Capital.
- Aerem will use the funds to expand its market presence, lending portfolio, and technology for its B2B marketplace, SunStore.
- The startup reported a significant revenue increase of nearly ninefold to ₹175 crore (US$20.52 million) in FY24.
keywords: University of Tokyo Edge Capital Partners

items.title: US Department of Energy to develop AI data centers by 2027
items.summary:
- The US Department of Energy plans to develop AI data centers by 2027.
- This initiative aims to enhance the capacity for artificial intelligence research and applications.
- The project is expected to advance technology and analytics in various fields, including climate forecasting and energy consumption optimization.

items.title: Indian court orders Wikipedia to remove defamatory content
items.summary:
- An Indian court has ordered Wikimedia Foundation to remove defamatory statements from ANI's Wikipedia page.
- The order follows a defamation lawsuit filed by ANI, claiming it was labeled a government propaganda tool.
- ANI is seeking 20 million rupees (approximately US$240,000) in damages and an apology.
- Wikimedia has not commented on the ruling or plans to appeal.
- The case underscores ongoing tensions between technology platforms and content regulation in India.

items.title: Trump open to tariff talks as markets lose trillions
items.summary:
- President Trump expressed willingness to negotiate tariffs if other countries offer "phenomenal" terms.
- His comments on April 3 came after White House officials indicated that tariffs were non-negotiable, raising market concerns.
- New tariffs are set to take effect on April 5, with a 10% baseline levy on imports, causing the S&P 500 to lose approximately $2 trillion in value, reflecting fears of a global trade war.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs threaten Big Tech’s AI expansion plans
items.summary:
- Trump's tariffs announced on Apr. 2 impose 34% duties on imports from China, 32% on Taiwan, and 25% on South Korea, with a 10% baseline on all imports.
- Tariffs may impact AI projects like Stargate, a $500 billion data-center initiative, due to economic challenges.
- Major cloud companies like Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon could face reduced spending on AI and cloud infrastructure due to financial pressures.

items.title: Accel leads $8m series A for AI-powered healthcare firm
items.summary:
- RapidClaims raised US$8 million in Series A funding led by Accel, with participation from Together Fund.
- Total funding for RapidClaims reaches US$11 million.
- Founded in 2023, RapidClaims specializes in automating revenue cycle management for healthcare providers.
- Funds will be used to enhance technology, expand market reach, and grow sales and marketing teams.

items.title: Indian self-publishing platform Pratilipi raises $20m series E
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based self-publishing platform Pratilipi raised US$20 million in series E funding, led by Jungle Ventures.
- Funding breakdown: US$12 million from equity at a US$100 million valuation and US$8 million in secondary funding.
- Plans to expand into animation, vertical drama shows, and the US market.
- Preparing for an IPO in early 2026 with formal banker engagement set for August 2025.

items.title: Amazon tests Buy for Me feature to shop from brand websites
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Amazon is piloting a new shopping feature called 'Buy for Me'.
- The feature allows users to shop directly from brand websites without leaving Amazon.
- This initiative aims to enhance customer convenience and increase brand partnerships.
- Early feedback suggests mixed reactions from users regarding its usability.
- The feature may affect competition among e-commerce platforms.

items.title: Tokyo Stock Exchange sets $68.5m valuation for startups by 2030
items.summary:
- The Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) plans to tighten listing requirements for startups.
- Startups must achieve a market valuation of 10 billion yen (US$68.5 million) within five years of going public.
- The current requirement is 4 billion yen (US$27.42 million) within ten years.
- The new rules are expected to take effect in 2030 or later.
- TSE has a three-tier system including Prime, Standard, and Growth Markets.

items.title: Indonesia plans to discuss Trump tariffs with Malaysia
items.summary:
- The Indonesian government is assessing the impact of new US import tariffs and preparing strategies to mitigate their effects.
- Starting Apr. 5, the US will impose a 10% tariff on all imports, with additional reciprocal tariffs beginning Apr. 9.
- Indonesia faces a 32% tariff, affecting key export sectors like electronics, textiles, and palm oil.
- The government plans to collaborate with Malaysia, the current ASEAN chair, to address the issue collectively, as all 10 ASEAN nations are affected by the tariffs.

items.title: No US, no prob: China takes climate lead
items.author: Elyssa
items.summary:
- The US is disengaged from climate talks, but countries like China are stepping up.
- In 2024, China achieved 96% power storage from wind and solar energy, a global record.
- Investments in China's power grid are focused on local energy transition efforts, not aiding other nations.
- China emphasizes the importance of other developed nations to support the global climate fight.
- China's grid operator asserts it can effectively manage intermittent renewable energy, addressing common criticisms of renewables' irregularity.

items.title: 50 rising startups in China
items.summary:
- The article tracks the latest trends in China through startups that have raised funding.
- Focuses on companies up to the Series E funding stage.
- For more information, the article links to a comprehensive database of tech companies in Asia and a research methodology page.

items.title: Tech stocks plunge after Trump imposes new tariffs
items.summary:
- Shares of Dell, Apple, Sonos, and HP fell sharply on April 3 after new tariffs were announced by President Trump.
- Tariffs, effective after midnight on April 5, will impose 10% minimum levy on imports; Taiwan faces 32%, South Korea 25%, China 34%, and Vietnam 46%.
- These measures target key electronics manufacturing hubs, impacting companies looking to diversify production from China.
- Stock drops: Dell -17%, Apple -9.5%, Sonos -15%, HP -18%.

items.title: Alphabet’s VC arm leads data platform provider’s $100m series D
items.summary:
- San Francisco-based data platform provider Redpanda raised US$100 million in series D funding.
- The round was led by Alphabet’s investment arm, GV, with participation from Lightspeed Venture Partners.
- Total funding for Redpanda now stands at US$265 million, with a valuation of US$1 billion.
- Funds will enhance Redpanda’s data platform for real-time data integration and processing.
- Redpanda introduced an agentic AI service for multi-agent systems with traceability and data governance.
- The company supports over 300 data connectors and is used by clients like Activision Blizzard, Cisco, and Vodafone.

items.title: Space solar firm raises $50m from A16z, actor Jared Leto, others
items.author: Baiju Bhatt
items.summary:
- Aetherflux, a space solar startup founded by Baiju Bhatt, raised US$50 million in Series A funding, bringing total funds to US$60 million.
- Funding round led by Index Ventures and Interlagos, with contributions from Breakthrough Energy Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, NEA, and private investors, including Jared Leto.
- Funds will support Aetherflux’s upcoming satellite demonstration in 2026, aiming to convert solar power into laser energy for transmission to Earth.
- The team includes experts from NASA, SpaceX, and Lockheed Martin, developing a ground station potentially at military sites.
- The mission seeks to evaluate the feasibility of power transmission from space, backed by the US Department of Defense.

items.title: IPhone prices may hit $2.3k after Trump’s tariffs
items.summary:
- Apple’s iPhone prices may rise significantly due to new tariffs from the US government.
- Analysts predict that tariffs on China-made products could increase iPhone 16 prices from $799 to over $1,100, with Pro Max models nearing $2,300.
- Apple faces the choice of absorbing the 54% China tariff or passing it onto consumers, and no exemptions have been announced for other models like the iPhone 16e (currently priced at $599).

items.title: Dubai fintech firm Fuse bags $6.6m seed funding
items.author: George Davis, James Smith
items.summary:
• Dubai-based fintech startup Fuse raised $6.6 million in seed funding to tackle payment challenges in MENA.
• Funding round led by Northzone, with contributions from Flourish Ventures and angel investors like Flutterwave CEO Olugbenga Agboola.
• Founded in 2023, Fuse offers a payments infrastructure with virtual IBANs for cross-border transactions without needing a local entity.
• The platform serves clients like Deel and Airbnb, planning to expand its team and product offerings with the new funds.

items.title: OpenAI co-leads $43m series A in US-based cybersecurity firm
items.summary:
- New York-based [Adaptive Security](https://www.techinasia.com/news/openai-coleads-43m-series-usbased-cybersecurity-firm) raised US$43 million in series A funding.
- The funding was co-led by OpenAI’s startup fund and Andreessen Horowitz.
- This is OpenAI's first investment in a cybersecurity firm.
- Adaptive Security focuses on simulating AI-driven social engineering attacks to train employees and assess vulnerabilities.
- The funds will be used to expand the engineering team and enhance the platform, which serves over 100 customers.

items.title: TikTok pilots artist platform in Asia-Pacific for music promotion
items.summary:
- TikTok is testing 'TikTok for Artists' to aid music promotion and fan engagement.
- The test is currently live in Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Korea, and Indonesia.
- Features include launching campaigns, encouraging Spotify and Apple Music pre-saves, and promoting exclusive merchandise.
- The platform provides insights into fan demographics and music performance and showcases fan-made videos.
- More updates will be provided soon following the shutdown of TikTok Music, focusing on music promotion.

items.title: Chips Act changes put Samsung, SK hynix US plans at risk
items.summary:
- The US government may adjust Chips Act subsidies impacting Samsung and SK hynix.
- Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick seeks increased US investments before granting funds.
- Global chipmakers encouraged to invest like TSMC's US$100 billion without extra subsidies.
- The Commerce Department is reviewing changes to the 25% tax credit and may withhold approved subsidies.

items.title: Tencent-backed streaming firm plans $500m bond issuance
items.summary:
- China Ruyi Holdings plans to raise between US$300 million and US$500 million through a convertible bond offering next week.
- The funds are expected to be used for a potential acquisition, with discussions in early stages.
- Major banks like Bank of America and Goldman Sachs are managing the bond issuance.
- This move reflects a broader trend of increased offshore equity fundraising by Chinese firms, with Q1 2025 seeing US$24 billion raised in equity capital markets.

items.title: Korean Air, Anduril to develop autonomous aerial vehicles
items.summary:
- Korean Air has signed an MOU with Anduril Industries to develop autonomous aerial vehicles (AAVs) in South Korea and the US.
- Korean Air has experience with medium-altitude unmanned aerial vehicles for the South Korean military, while Anduril focuses on AI, drones, and data analytics.
- The partnership aims to enhance South Korea’s defense capabilities and create opportunities for domestic companies in the global unmanned vehicle market.

items.title: A16z, others back $40m investment in healthtech startup Thatch
items.summary:
- Thatch, a San Francisco-based health insurance solutions startup, has raised $40 million in series B funding.
- The funding round was led by Index Ventures with participation from Andreessen Horowitz and General Catalyst, bringing total equity funding to $84.5 million since October 2021.
- Thatch's valuation has tripled since its series A round in February 2024.
- The startup allows employers to offer ICHRA to employees, enabling tax-free funds for healthcare expenses.
- CEO Chris Ellis noted that 50% of users maintain an average balance of $250 monthly.
- The company has onboarded over 1,000 companies, including notable clients like Dave’s Hot Chicken and Jersey Mike’s.
- Thatch intends to utilize the new funding to enhance its platform and further expand in the employer-sponsored healthcare sector.

items.title: YouTube Shorts launches AI stickers, new video tools
items.summary:
- YouTube Shorts introduces new features for video creation, including a video editor and AI-generated stickers.
- Enhanced video editor allows adjustment of clip timing, rearranging clips, adding music, and previewing videos.
- New AI stickers let users create custom stickers from text prompts, and beat-syncing aligns clips with music.
- Updates expected to attract creators amid potential TikTok ban in the US on April 5, 2025.

items.title: Dollar falls as tariffs raise concerns over global growth
items.summary:
- The US dollar reached six-month lows against the euro, yen, and Swiss franc after President Trump's announcement of new import tariffs.
- A 10% tariff on all US imports and higher rates for certain trading partners raised global growth concerns, leading to market declines.
- Investors are moving to safer assets like bonds and gold amidst the turmoil.
- The euro increased by 1.74% to US$1.1037, while the dollar decreased by 1.95% against the yen and 2.35% against the Swiss franc.
- Analysts warn that the tariffs may cause economic stagnation and inflation, with concerns over a crisis of confidence in the US dollar.

items.title: Uber, WeRide to launch self-driving vehicles in Dubai
items.summary:
- Uber partners with WeRide and Dubai's RTA to launch self-driving vehicles.
- Goal is to achieve 25% autonomous trips in Dubai by 2030.
- WeRide is the first autonomous partner for Uber in Dubai, focusing on pilot programs and safety.
- WeRide secured a national license for self-driving in July 2023, starting operations in Abu Dhabi in December 2024.
- Details on the Dubai pilot's timeline and rollout will be announced soon.

items.title: Microsoft delays Jakarta data center over AI oversupply risk
items.summary:
- Microsoft has delayed several data center projects globally, including in Jakarta, due to strategic flexibility concerns.
- Analysts suggest the delay is tied to risks of AI infrastructure oversupply.
- Work on one Jakarta site is paused, but the Indonesia Central cloud region is still scheduled to launch in Q2 2025.
- Microsoft allocated US$80 billion for data centers for the fiscal year ending June 2025 but will slow new spending to upgrade existing facilities.
- Adjustments are attributed to overestimated AI demand and supply chain challenges.

items.title: Aussie politicians turn to Chinese social media ahead of 2025 election
items.summary:
- Australian politicians are using Chinese social media platforms like Xiaohongshu to engage with Chinese-Australian communities before the federal election on May 3.
- Key electorates like Bennelong and Chisholm are seeing MPs such as Jerome Laxale actively reach out to these communities.
- Laxale has distributed 30,000 red envelopes with QR codes linking to his Xiaohongshu and WeChat accounts, stating the importance of communicating where the electorate is.
- The Liberal Party is also focusing on reconnecting with Chinese-Australian voters after a 6.6% decline in support during the 2022 election.

items.title: Intel stock rises 4% after report on TSMC joint venture
items.summary:
- Intel's stock increased by over 4% on April 3, after a report suggested a joint venture with TSMC.
- This rise occurred following a previous drop of more than 5% earlier that day.
- The report indicates a tentative agreement for a joint venture that may utilize Intel's manufacturing facilities.
- The joint venture would enable Intel and U.S. chipmakers to hold a majority stake.
- The collaboration was reportedly explored at the request of the Trump administration, according to Bloomberg News in February.
- Intel has yet to officially comment on the report.

items.title: Trump proposes TikTok sale for tariff relief deal
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump suggested a deal involving TikTok and US tariffs on Chinese imports.
- TikTok faces an April 5 deadline to finalize a sale to a non-Chinese buyer to avoid a ban in the US.
- Trump stated that several investors have shown interest, and his administration is 'very close' to an agreement.
- This proposal comes after Trump's announcement of a 10% baseline tariff on all US imports, affecting Chinese goods with a 54% tariff.
- TikTok has not commented on the proposed deal.

items.title: Pizza chain Papa John’s expands AI in ordering with Google Cloud
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Papa John’s International is enhancing its customer ordering process by integrating AI via an expanded partnership with Google Cloud.
- New features will include personalized push notifications, marketing emails, loyalty program offers, an online chatbot, and voice-assisted ordering.
- Chief digital officer Kevin Vasconi highlighted scalability, security, and cost-efficiency as priorities for the AI integration.
- CEO Todd Penegor noted the company’s previous technological lag but is optimistic about AI advancements.
- Future plans include using AI for in-store operations, like optimizing delivery routes and managing inventory.
- Papa John’s was the first national pizza chain to offer online ordering to all U.S. customers in 2001.

items.title: AI drives Chinese Q&A platform Zhihu to its first profitability
items.summary:
- Zhihu has announced its first quarterly profitability since going public.
- The achievement is attributed to the integration of AI, particularly the new "Zhida" feature.
- Zhida automatically generates answers using content from verified experts, attracting over 10 million monthly active users.
- Zhihu has over 81 million monthly active users and is compared to platforms like Quora and LinkedIn.
- The platform aims to be a center for professional knowledge sharing following LinkedIn's exit from mainland China in 2023.
- Zhihu's AI-driven features strengthen its position in China's digital landscape by leveraging its professional and scholarly network.

items.title: Singapore tops startup growth as Asian cities rise: report
items.summary:
- Singapore has surpassed San Francisco in the concentration of fast-growing startups according to the 2025 Hypergrowth Startup Index by HubSpot for Startups.
- Asian cities like Shanghai and Beijing are emerging as prominent innovation hubs.
- Investors are prioritizing sustainable business models and strategic partnerships over rapid scaling.
- Monthly deal counts have decreased by 50% since 2021, while average deal sizes have risen by 43%, now at US$50 million in 2024.
- Mergers and acquisitions are the dominant exit strategy, making up 43% of recent exits, with IPOs only accounting for 6%.
- Traditional sectors such as energy are outperforming tech-driven industries, with energy growth at 37%, IT at 36%, and B2B at 35%.

items.title: ASML CEO warns geopolitics may hurt innovation under US tariffs
items.summary:
- ASML raises concerns about geopolitical tensions hindering industry innovation.
- CEO Christophe Fouquet points to export controls affecting collaboration but doesn't specify on new US tariffs.
- The US tariffs, imposed by President Trump, significantly impact imports from several countries, including the Netherlands, with an uncertain effect on chip manufacturing tools.
- ASML’s EUV lithography machines are critical for high-end electronics, with 16% of 2024 net sales from US facilities.
- Major clients like Intel, TSMC, and Samsung are expanding operations in the US due to incentives from the 2022 Chips and Science Act.
- The Netherlands faces a 24% duty under new tariffs, leading to potential EU retaliatory measures.

items.title: The Radical Fund, IFC back women-led climate tech startups
items.summary:
- The Radical Fund partners with the IFC to support women-led climate tech startups in Singapore.
- Women-led startups receive less than 2% of global venture capital according to Pitchbook 2023.
- Barriers in Southeast Asia limit women's roles in climate tech despite high potential.
- The We Fund Climate program offers funding, workshops, and strategies for gender inclusion.
- In November 2024, they co-hosted an event at the Dubai Global Women’s Forum to promote inclusive investment.
- The initiative aims for at least 30% of its climate tech portfolio to be women-led and 30% representation of women in leadership roles.
- Focus on early-stage investments in Southeast Asia addressing climate adaptation and mitigation.
